channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump extends TikTok reprieve as deal nears
item.description: While legally questionable, the extension comes just as it appears China and the U.S. may finally have a deal on TikTok's fate.

item.title: From heart to skin to hair, 'Replaceable You' dives into the science of transplant
item.description: Science writer Mary Roach chronicles both the history and the latest science of body part replacement in her new book. She also answers the question: ...

item.title: The U.S. said it would burn $9.7 million of birth control. Its fate is still unclear
item.description: Questions about their fate swirled after the government's July deadline for destruction came and went. Then came a false report they'd been incinerate...

item.title: 'People are scared': Congress grapples with increasing political violence
item.description: House Republicans put forth a proposal to fund the government that includes $30 million for lawmaker security, as Congress grapples with increasing po...

item.title: RFK Jr. wants to end mental health screenings in schools. Experts say it's a bad idea
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy and Education Secretary Linda McMahon are against schools giving kids standardized questionnaires about their menta...

item.title: Deal is done to keep TikTok in the US, says Trump
item.description: The social media platform had faced a ban in the US over national security concerns.

item.title: 9/16: CBS Morning News
item.description: Charlie Kirk murder suspect appears to have confessed to killing on Discord; Federal Reserve expected to cut interest rates.

item.title: Trump says he will sue New York Times for $15bn
item.description: He has accused the paper of defamation and libel, saying it served as a "mouthpiece" for Democrats.

item.title: 8/12: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump threatens to sue Jerome Powell over Fed building renovations; Taylor Swift announces new album, “The Life of a Showgirl."

item.title: Suspect in Kirk killing charged with aggravated murder as prosecutor says DNA found on gun trigger
Coup plot charges for former Romanian presidential candidate
item.description: Prosecutors say the right-wing former presidential candidate conspired to overthrow constitutional order in the country.

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz announces run for third term
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz on Tuesday announced his plans to seek reelection, launching a rare bid for a third consecutive term that would make history i...

item.title: Acting legend Robert Redford dies aged 89
item.description: The acting star was famous for roles in The Sting and Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

item.title: Social media has us in its grip and won’t let go. The Charlie Kirk killing is a case study
Pentagon says troops can only be exempt from shaving their facial hair for a year
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has ordered that troops who need an exemption from shaving their facial hair for longer than a year should now be kicke...

item.title: Kirk shooting suspect appeared to confess on Discord
item.description: Tyler Robinson is thought to have discussed the killing on the online platform before his arrest.

item.title: Growing number of affluent consumers shop at discount stores. Here's why.
item.description: Discount retailers like Walmart and Dollar Tree are seeing an influx of more upscale consumers, market research data shows.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect charged with aggravated murder, could face death penalty
item.description: Tyler Robinson, the man accused of assassinating conservative activist Charlie Kirk in Utah, was charged with aggravated murder. Follow live updates.
